questions.question: Which UNESCO World Heritage site is famous for an ancient temple complex that is the largest religious monument in the world, originally constructed as a Hindu temple dedicated to the god Vishnu?
questions.context: This site, located in Southeast Asia, was later transformed into a Buddhist temple and is known for its grandiose architecture and extensive bas-reliefs.

questions.question: In which capital city can you find an iconic modern marvel, a concert hall designed by a famous architect with a facade resembling sails, that was inaugurated in 1973?
questions.context: Located on the shores of an iconic harbor, this architectural masterpiece was designed by Jørn Utzon and is a symbol of contemporary architecture.

questions.question: What is the site of a pivotal historical battle in 1815 where Napoleon Bonaparte was defeated, marking the end of his rule as Emperor of the French?
questions.context: This battlefield is located in Western Europe and witnessed the combined forces of the British army led by the Duke of Wellington and the Prussian army.

questions.question: Which famous museum, located in the capital city of Italy, houses an extensive collection of art and historical artifacts, including renowned works like the 'Laocoön and His Sons' sculpture?
questions.context: This museum complex, part of the smallest independent state in the world, attracts millions of visitors annually and includes the Sistine Chapel with its ceiling painted by Michelangelo.

questions.question: Which ancient ruin, recognized as one of the New Seven Wonders of the World, is a 15th-century Incan citadel located on a mountain ridge in South America?
questions.context: This archaeological site, set high in the Andes Mountains above the Urubamba River valley, was built in the classical Inca style, with polished dry-stone walls.
